metadata.title: CVE-2015-7645 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
Adobe Flash Player 18.x through 18.0.0.252 and 19.x through 19.0.0.207 onWindows and OS X and 11.x through 11.2.202.535 on Linux allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted SWF file, as exploited inthe wild in October 2015.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 11.2.202.535ubuntu0.14.04.1
flashplugin-installer - 11.2.202.535ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.2.202.535ubuntu0.14.04.1').
